chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan L Redmond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License (1st Violation). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 90 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Tapia advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nathan L Redmond in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   

State moves to amend count 1 to an OWL (1st).
Defense enters a No Contest plea to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
To be paid in fulll within 90 days.
Alternate:  Entry of a Civil Judgment.

Returned Notice of Hearing as Addressed to Nathan L. Redmond for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on 6-23-2022 at 10:00am
Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as Addressed. Unable to Forward
